M01.title: The Token
M01.brief: A boy arrives with a wax seal. Someone is warning you. Someone is hunting you.
M01.monologue: They've already decided my death. Time to decide theirs.

M02.title: The Empty Arena
M02.brief: You face Rhesus in rehearsal. You learn the fix is deeper than you thought.
M02.monologue: Rhesus is as trapped as I am. We're both expensive enough to be valuable.

M03.title: The Case
M03.brief: You steal a ledger from Sabina. Names. Payments. Corruption pressed into wax.
M03.monologue: If I don't move it, I can't breathe. If I do, I can't hide.

M04.title: The Quarry Breathes
M04.brief: Ridge City. Men cough like it's a rhythm. The magistrate's man finds you.
M04.monologue: They want it. I want not to be owned. This is where we find out who blinks first.

M05.title: The Quill's Lesson
M05.brief: Port City. The Quill owns shadows here. They have Moth. They demand the ledger.
M05.monologue: I said no. That's all I had. But Moth's blood is on my hands now, and that changed something.

M06.title: The Shrine Awakens
M06.brief: Iona and the shrine network want the ledger. Marcellus's reach extends even here.
M06.monologue: The ledger exists in more hands now. I'm no longer carrying it. I'm becoming it.

M07.title: The Copied Page
M07.brief: You discover copies of the ledger spreading. The story can't be buried anymore.
M07.monologue: Multiple hands hold the truth now. The machine is afraid. I can feel it.

M08.title: Building Opposition
M08.brief: Other fighters, merchants, believers—people willing to stand against the narrative.
M08.monologue: They're not following me. They're standing where I stand. That's different. That matters.

M09.title: The Factions Reveal
M09.brief: State, Cult, Syndicate—they all want the ledger. Each has a different vision of control.
M09.monologue: The machine isn't one hand. It's many, fighting each other with my bones as stakes.

M10.title: The Fellow Trapped
M10.brief: Rhesus faces his own reckoning. Will he keep the cage, or help break it?
M10.monologue: Rhesus chose. His silence was an answer. Now he can't take it back.

M11.title: The Boy Becomes Real
M11.brief: Moth is no longer just a messenger. He's bleeding for the story, not the coin.
M11.monologue: Moth paid in bruises so I could breathe. I can't undo that. I can only honor it.

M12.title: The Trainer's Bargain
M12.brief: Varro made a deal. Now he must choose: the deal or the man.
M12.monologue: Varro is choosing. The weight on his shoulders mirrors the weight on mine. We're bound now.

M13.title: The Arena Riot
M13.brief: The crowd sees the machinery. Marcellus offers a final choice: obey or die.
M13.monologue: The crowd knows now. They've been made fools. Marcellus will burn this city to keep his narrative. So will I.

M14.title: Breaking the Cage
M14.brief: Varro sacrifices. The guards chase. You run toward whatever comes next.
M14.monologue: Varro bought me time with his body. I can't waste it. I won't.

M15.title: Loyalty Under Fire
M15.brief: Rhesus, Iona, Moth—each faces pressure to betray. Each chooses differently.
M15.monologue: Loyalty is tested now. Some will break. Some will burn. I can't save anyone but myself.

M16.title: Choosing a Path
M16.brief: You must commit to one vision: State order, Cult faith, or Syndicate freedom. Or stand alone.
M16.monologue: I can wear their colors, or wear none at all. Either way, I'm branded now.

M17.title: The Machine Strikes Back
M17.brief: Marcellus moves with full force. The city realizes someone is fighting for real.
M17.monologue: They're afraid. That's when they're most dangerous. They'll burn the city to bury the story.

M18.title: Last Line
M18.brief: Rhesus, Iona, Moth—each makes their final stand. Some fall. Some survive.
M18.monologue: They died standing. That's a kind of victory the machine can't measure.

M19.title: The Silence Before
M19.brief: Preparation. Waiting. The final confrontation looms.
M19.monologue: I've said no a hundred times now. One more no coming. This one will break something.

M20.title: The Noon Blood
M20.brief: Face Marcellus. The crowd watches. The machine demands a story. You give it the truth.
M20.monologue: I'm not a hero. I'm just a man who kept saying no until it mattered.

token_arrives.text: The boy's message was warning and invitation both: they want you dead, and they've already decided how. That means you still have time.

copied_ledger.text: You realize the ledger exists in multiple hands now. You're no longer the only weapon. You're the story.

public_exposure.text: The arena riot showed the crowd the machinery that moves them. Now they're angry. Now it matters.

Rhesus.role: Fellow trapped fighter, recognizes Cassian's cage

Moth.role: Boy messenger, becomes symbol of cost

Iona.role: Shrine representative caught between faith and hunger

Varro.role: Your trainer, makes the deal, pays the final cost
